data.title: MGBot info
data.body: Which platform targets can mgbot build for?

data.title: TitleContainer Fixes
data.body:
This fixes TitleContainer.OpenStream() to not allow absolute paths (as per-XNA) and in the process fixing #1295.
- TitleContainer.OpenStream now throws an exception when passed an absolute path.
- Added internal for TitleContainer.Location.
- Removed most uses of ContentManager.RootDirectoryFullPath.
- Unified the 5 copies of TitleContainer.cs into a single one for all platforms.

I tested this on WindowsGL and Windows8.  It could use some testing on iOS, Android, and MacOS.

data.body: #1245 - these are graphics for a dark background

data.title: #1244 Transparent versions of the logo graphics and icons.
data.body: Transparent backgrounded images of the logo and logo text, including icon files that have an alpha channel.

Thanks

data.title: [WinDX] Support TouchPanel.MouseTouchPoint/MouseGestures
data.body: For Windows desktop apps, sends pertinent touch/move/release touch events from mouse events. This gives equivalent behavior that Windows 8 apps have already.

data.body:
The function can be overridden in XNA 4.0 by
protected override void OnApply()

but in MonoGame it is
protected override bool OnApply()

This is fully manually writed own comments for Color(these comments are NOT stealed from MSDN).  

Please accept this - I did a hard work !

data.title: PVRTC support added to pipeline.
data.body:
A couple of questions came up while integrating this:

Ended up making a PVRTCBitmapContent, since it will need different implementations of TryCopyTo/From(). Seeing all of the texture formats we'll end up supporting, should we have a single CompressedBitmapContent class that implements the different texture formats?

How much control are we giving to the user when it comes to texture formats. Technically, PVRTC and DXT can work on Android. What would be the right way of choosing the output format?

PVRTC can do either 2BPP or 4BPP. Where should this be exposed to the user? For now I just forced 4BPP.

Changes in this PR allow us to move PVRTexLibC out of MonoGame's repo, and into it's own. This way we open the possibility of other developers working on it. I'll be submitting a PR to the Dependency repo that moves these .dll's from Tools to ThirdParty. Don't merge this until that's complete.

data.title: MonoGame/WindowsGL not rendering correctly to multiple GLControls
data.body:
See (http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/431834) for an in-depth description of the problem.

Under XNA, we could render to multiple controls backed by a single GraphicsDevice in WinForms, using this well-known tutorial: (http://xbox.create.msdn.com/en-US/education/catalog/sample/winforms_series_1)

I've attempted to adapt this to OpenTK.GLControl by replacing the call to GraphicsDevice.Present() with a GLControl.MakeCurrent() / GLControl.SwapBuffers() pair at the beginning and ending of drawing.  This works fine for a single GLControl.  When multiple controls are present, basic GL manipulations can be performed on all controls, such as color clearing or GL immediate mode drawing, but MonoGame routines will only have an effect in one of the controls.

I've provided a test case (http://hocuspocus.taloncrossing.com/rii/GLControlTest.zip), which is a slightly modified version of the Winforms Series tutorial.  Both controls render a triangle in XNA, but only the left control renders in MonoGame.  MonoGame/OpenTK assemblies and pdbs included, since it needs a build of OpenTK.GLControl, and GraphicsDevice.cs was modified slightly.  See the codeplex discussion for detail.

data.title: No Templates in VS 2012
data.body:
Hi guys, I installed what seems to be the latest updated release of MonoGame from http://monogame.codeplex.com/releases/view/100041
VS2010 templates are to be found in the Add New Project dialog, but not in VS2012. I've verified that the template zips are being deployed to 
C:\Users\Daniel\Documents\Visual Studio 2012\Templates\ProjectTemplates\Visual C#\MonoGame

I'm not sure why VS2012 Ultimate isn't picking them up. Any ideas?
I'm using Windows 8.

Cheers,
Daniel

I'm getting a System.AggregateException.

data.title: Resuming a paused sound was not working correctly
data.body:
in Desktop OpenAL due to a guard in Play that prevented the same instance being played twice. Now also protects against Resume and Pause being called many times.
Fixes issue #1263.

data.title: Fix Sound compiling on Android, Y Axis on Ouya
data.body:
Some misc fixes from porting my GGJ2013 game to OUYA.
- Fixing the Android build from the latest Song constructor changes.
- Fixing the Y Axis direction, was reversed.

the duration from .xnb file while loading the song)

- Added Windows desktop DirectX template.

- The documentation is based on http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.keyboardstate(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx, http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.keyboard(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx, http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.keys(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx but **I've worded them on my own**

data.body:
Added API documentation for Mouse.cs and MouseState.cs based on http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.mouse.aspx and http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.mousestate.aspx.

Though I'm not sure if it's okay to base on MSDN docs.

data.title: This is a fix for #1280. Added lock around access to management lists.
data.body: Added lock around the access to the sound effect management lists. Also changed the use of HashSet in lieu of List.

data.title: Fix incorrect use of Dispose in ShaderProgramCache
data.body: The finalizer was telling Dispose(bool) to dispose of managed objects, which is incorrect.  This was causing a crash on exit.

data.title: iOS - iPhone 5 - Sound effect crashing
data.body:
With the recent develop3d branch, I found that all of our games, when sound effects are enabled, will crash randomly:

```
at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1/Enumerator.MoveNext () <0x0002c>
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.OpenALSoundController.Update () <0x000f8>
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGamePlatform.BeforeDraw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime) <0x00018>
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime) <0x00028>
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick () <0x00538>
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGamePlatform.Tick () <0x00054>
at MonoTouch.Foundation.NSActionDispatcher.Apply () <0x00014>
```

Nothing more specific yet, just found this after we got a new iPhone 5 today to test on. iPad G1 and iPhone 4s didn't appear to have this issue.
